this_title: IKEA: How Do They Really Do It?
introduction: Let’s unbox Swedish mega-giant furniture retailer IKEA.In this hour-long program, industry insiders, retail experts and former employees lift the lid on the world’s biggest furniture seller, IKEA. They divulge the secrets of the massive maze-like warehouse stores, reveal the tricks they use to get customers to spend and uncover how the stores are designed to keep us there….for hours. Starting with its humble beginnings in 1943, we’ll explore everything from its unique flatpack concept, those delicious IKEA meatballs, and how the Swedish retailer has inspired a worldwide army of up-cyclers who turn its budget furnishings into the hippest furniture around.PRODUCERS:  Ben AlgarEXECUTIVE PRODUCERS:  Harriet Scott
chinese_title: IKEA: How Do They Really Do It?
